column3: Disco is a style of pop music that was popular in the mid-1970s. Disco music has a strong beat that people can dance to. People usually dance to disco music at bars called disco clubs. The word "disco" is also used to refer to the style of dancing that people do to disco music
column4: or to the style of clothes that people wear to go disco dancing. Disco was at its most popular in the United States and Europe in the 1970s and early 1980s. Disco was brought into the mainstream by the hit movie Saturday Night Fever
column5: which was released in 1977. This movie
column7: showed people doing disco dancing. Many radio stations played disco in the late 1970s.

column3: The blues is a form of music that started in the United States during the start of the 20th century. It was started by former African slaves from spirituals
column5: and chants. The first blues songs were called Delta blues. These songs came from the area near the mouth of the Mississippi River.

column3: Latin American music is the music of all countries in Latin America (and the Caribbean) and comes in many varieties. Latin America is home to musical styles such as the simple
column4: rural conjunto music of northern Mexico
column6: the rhythmic sounds of the Puerto Rican plena
column8: and the simple and moving Andean flute. Music has played an important part recently in Latin America''s politics
column9: the nueva canción movement being a prime example. Latin music is very diverse
column10: with the only truly unifying thread being the use of Latin-derived languages
column15: such as those found in Haiti.

column3: Reggae is a music genre first developed in Jamaica in the late 1960s. While sometimes used in a broader sense to refer to most types of Jamaican music
column4: the term reggae more properly denotes a particular music style that originated following on the development of ska and rocksteady.

column3: Pop music is a music genre that developed from the mid-1950s as a softer alternative to rock ''n'' roll and later to rock music. It has a focus on commercial recording
column4: often oriented towards a youth market
column5: usually through the medium of relatively short and simple love songs. While these basic elements of the genre have remained fairly constant
column6: pop music has absorbed influences from most other forms of popular music
column7: particularly borrowing from the development of rock music
column8: and utilizing key technological innovations to produce new variations on existing themes.

column3: Classical music is a very general term which normally refers to the standard music of countries in the Western world. It is music that has been composed by musicians who are trained in the art of writing music (composing) and written down in music notation so that other musicians can play it. Classical music can also be described as "art music" because great art (skill) is needed to compose it and to perform it well. Classical music differs from pop music because it is not made just in order to be popular for a short time or just to be a commercial success.
